Package stincmale.ratmex.meter

Class AbstractRingBufferRateMeter<S,C extends ConcurrentRateMeterConfig>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stincmale.ratmex.meter.AbstractRateMeter<S,C>
      • stincmale.ratmex.meter.AbstractRingBufferRateMeter<S,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - A type of the configuration.
    S - A type that represents statistics.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable<S>, RateMeter<S>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConcurrentRingBufferRateMeter, RingBufferRateMeter

    public abstract class AbstractRingBufferRateMeter<S,C extends ConcurrentRateMeterConfig>
extends AbstractRateMeter<S,C>
    This is an almost complete implementation of AbstractRateMeter which only requires a correct parameters to be provided to the constructor. Depending on the arguments the constructed object can be either sequential, or concurrent.

    This implementation of RateMeter uses a ring buffer with the underlying LongArray to store and access a samples history.

    There are two modes in thread-safe implementation:

    • ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.Mode.STRICT (default)
    • ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.Mode.RELAXED_TICKS (strongly recommended) - ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.getMode() is false. Displays much better performance in terms of both throughput and latency than in ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.Mode.STRICT mode, and yet manages to correctly register all ticks in practice (the greater the samples history length the less probable an incorrect registration).

      The number of situations in which AbstractRingBufferRateMeter might have incorrectly registered ticks can be accessed via ConcurrentRateMeterStats.incorrectlyRegisteredTicksEventsCount(). If this method returns 0, then it is guaranteed that all ticks which registrations happened before the invocation of the method were registered correctly.

    Advantages

    • Unlike AbstractNavigableMapRateMeter, this implementation does not produces garbage, unless customizable tools supplied to the constructor produce garbage (e.g. StampedLockStrategy produces garbage because StampedLock does).
    • Unlike AbstractNavigableMapRateMeter, this implementation takes advantage of memory locality of data stored in samples history.

    Disadvantages

    • Unlike AbstractNavigableMapRateMeter, this implementation cannot tolerate a large ratio of AbstractRateMeter.getSamplesInterval() to AbstractRateMeter.getTimeSensitivity(). The reason for this is that a ring buffer requires all objects representing samples to always exist, and if the number of such objects (which is the same as the aforementioned ratio) is large, then it can have a substantial negative effect on the performance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double rate​(long tNanos)
      Calculates rate of ticks (measured in samplesInterval-1) as if tNanos were the right boundary of the samples window, if tNanos is ahead of or within the safe samples history; otherwise returns RateMeter.rateAverage().
      RateMeterReading rate​(long tNanos, RateMeterReading reading)
      This method is equivalent to RateMeter.rate(long), but provides a complete measured data, while RateMeter.rate(long) returns only a rate value.
      double rateAverage​(long tNanos)
      Calculates an average (mean) rate of ticks (measured in samplesInterval-1) from the start till the tNanos, if tNanos is greater than RateMeter.rightSamplesWindowBoundary(), otherwise returns RateMeter.rateAverage().
      protected void registerIncorrectlyRegisteredTicksEvent​()
      This method is called by tick(long, long) not more than once per invocation of tick(long, long) when there is a chance that it might have failed to correctly register ticks.
      long rightSamplesWindowBoundary​()
      Instant that corresponds to the right border of the samples window.
      void tick​(long count, long tNanos)
      Registers a sample of count ticks at tNanos instant.
      long ticksCount​()
      Calculates the number of ticks inside the samples window (current ticks).
      RateMeterReading ticksCount​(RateMeterReading reading)
      This method is equivalent to RateMeter.ticksCount(), but provides a complete measured data, while RateMeter.ticksCount() returns only the current ticks count.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractRingBufferRateMeter

        protected AbstractRingBufferRateMeter​(long startNanos,
                                      java.time.Duration samplesInterval,
                                      C config,
                                      java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Integer,? extends LongArray> samplesHistorySupplier,
                                      boolean sequential)
        Parameters:
        startNanos - A starting point that is used to calculate elapsed time in nanoseconds (tNanos).
        samplesInterval - A size of the samples window. Must not be null, see RateMeter for valid values.
        config - An additional configuration. Must not be null.
        samplesHistorySupplier - A supplier providing an object that will be used to store and access the samples history. The LongArray provided by this supplier must be thread-safe if sequential argument is false.
        sequential - Specifies whether the RateMeter must be thread-safe (will be used concurrently, so the value is false), or not (will be used sequentially, so the value is true).

    • Method Detail

      • rightSamplesWindowBoundary

        public final long rightSamplesWindowBoundary​()
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        Instant that corresponds to the right border of the samples window. At the very beginning this is equal to RateMeter.getStartNanos(). This border can be moved to the right by the RateMeter.tick(long, long) method.
        Returns:
        The rightmost registered instant.

      • ticksCount

        public final long ticksCount​()
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        Calculates the number of ticks inside the samples window (current ticks).
        Returns:
        Number of current ticks.

      • ticksCount

        public final RateMeterReading ticksCount​(RateMeterReading reading)
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        This method is equivalent to RateMeter.ticksCount(), but provides a complete measured data, while RateMeter.ticksCount() returns only the current ticks count.
        Parameters:
        reading - A RateMeterReading to be filled with a measured data.
        Returns:
        reading filled with the measured data. The reading is always accurate.

      • tick

        public final void tick​(long count,
                       long tNanos)
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        Registers a sample of count ticks at tNanos instant. If tNanos is greater than current RateMeter.rightSamplesWindowBoundary() then this method moves the samples window such that its right boundary is at tNanos.
        Parameters:
        count - Number of ticks. May be negative, zero, or positive. If zero then the method does nothing, otherwise adds count to the currently registered number of ticks at the specified instant, or just remembers count ticks if no ticks were registered at the specified instant.
        tNanos - An instant (a pair (startNanos, elapsedNanos)) at which count ticks need to be registered.

      • rateAverage

        public final double rateAverage​(long tNanos)
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        Calculates an average (mean) rate of ticks (measured in samplesInterval-1) from the start till the tNanos, if tNanos is greater than RateMeter.rightSamplesWindowBoundary(), otherwise returns RateMeter.rateAverage().
        Parameters:
        tNanos - An effective (imaginary) right boundary of the samples window.
        Returns:
        Average rate of ticks or 0 if tNanos is equal to RateMeter.getStartNanos().

      • rate

        public final double rate​(long tNanos)
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        Calculates rate of ticks (measured in samplesInterval-1) as if tNanos were the right boundary of the samples window, if tNanos is ahead of or within the safe samples history; otherwise returns RateMeter.rateAverage().
        Parameters:
        tNanos - An effective (imaginary) right boundary of the samples window.

      • rate

        public final RateMeterReading rate​(long tNanos,
                                   RateMeterReading reading)
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        This method is equivalent to RateMeter.rate(long), but provides a complete measured data, while RateMeter.rate(long) returns only a rate value.
        Parameters:
        tNanos - An effective (imaginary) right boundary of the samples window.
        reading - A RateMeterReading to be filled with a measured data.
        Returns:
        reading filled with the measured data. The reading is not accurate in cases when the method returns RateMeter.rateAverage().

      • registerIncorrectlyRegisteredTicksEvent

        protected void registerIncorrectlyRegisteredTicksEvent​()
        This method is called by tick(long, long) not more than once per invocation of tick(long, long) when there is a chance that it might have failed to correctly register ticks. Such a failure can only happen if this object is being used concurrently (see AbstractRingBufferRateMeter(long, Duration, ConcurrentRateMeterConfig, Function, boolean)) and ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.getMode() is false.
